File photo of sand artist Sudarsan Pattnaik creating a sand sculpture of turtles with the message ‘Give us space to live’ at Puri.— PHOTO: PTI

Carcasses of over 150 Olive Ridley turtles and a bottlenose dolphin washed ashore were recovered by Forest department officials here on Wednesday, a top official said.

The carcasses were found on the beach near Pantha Niwas.

“We suspect that the turtles were killed after being hit by the fishing trawlers in the sea,” said Sarat Chandra Behera, an official of the Puri-Balukhand forest range, adding that the carcasses have been sent for post-mortem. The turtles in large numbers come to Gahirmatha, mouth of rivers Devi and Rushikulya on the Odisha coast for annual nesting, he said.

Though there is a prohibition on fishing for a distance of 20 km from the beach, the trawler operators undertake fishing illegally there, Mr. Behera said.

Sand artist Sudarshan Patnaik said he was saddened by the death of the turtles. — PTI

Officials suspect they were killed after being hit by fishing trawlers
title: Carcasses of over 150 Olive Ridley turtles found
